arts.ttl: Stunning Lewis Wing brace helps Reading into play-offs with comfortable Cambridge win
arts.sum: Reading moved into the League One play-off places with a convincing 3-0 win over Cambridge United at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. Less than 8,500 supporters braved the cold and many were regretting that at half-time as a lacklustre period of football ensued, however three goals in 15 minutes during the second period took the game away from the U's. Lewis Wing netted a brace of trademark strikes from long range while youngster Mamadi Camara scored his first home league goal to inflict defeat on Garry Monk's relegation-threatened outfit. Matching the overall feel at the stadium, the first half was flat and lacking any real tempo in the cold conditions. As ever, effort could not be questioned but the whole area needed a boost.

arts.ttl: Lewis Wing bags a brace as Reading sweep aside Cambridge
Reading team news: Royals name strong side for Cambridge United test
arts.sum: Reading have named an unchanged side from last week's 2-2 draw with Barnsley for tonight's home clash with Cambridge United. The U's are struggling in the relegation zone of League One but have drawn three successive matches prior to Saturday's FA Cup exit at the hands of Wigan Athletic. The Royals needed extra time to progress past non-league Harborough Town on Sunday but remain with plenty of faces from the match less than 48 hours ago. Joel Pereira comes back in between the sticks, behind a back four of Michael Craig; Tyler Bindon; Louie Holzman and Andre Garcia.

arts.ttl: Televised clash with promotion chasers postponed after Reading win in FA Cup
arts.sum: Wrexham's first trip to Reading for over 20 years has been postponed following Sunday's 5-3 win over Harborough Town in the FA Cup. The Royals needed extra-time to squeeze past the eighth tier Bees in round two, setting up a third round clash over the weekend of January 10. Reading were due to host the Red Dragons at 12.30pm on Saturday, January 11- their first visit to the Select Car Leasing Stadium since November 2001.

arts.ttl: 'The league is what we live for': Reading boss on 'unpredictable' Cambridge United
arts.sum: Reading boss Ruben Selles is looking forward to returning to League One action this evening as 'unpredictable' Cambridge United visit the SCL Stadium. Garry Monk's side are sat in the bottom four and three points adrift from safety. Exiting the FA Cup on Saturday as Wigan Athletic scored an extra-time winner, the U's had drawn their previous three league meetings. Captained by former Royal Michael Morrison, Cambridge have won three of their 16 league fixtures and head to Berkshire where Reading have tasted defeat just once to date.

arts.ttl: Tickets on sale as Reading legend makes return to town next year in Q&A session
arts.sum: Reading goalscoring legend Jimmy Quinn is confirmed for a Q&A event at the Purple Turtle on Sunday, June 22. Quinn joined Reading in 1992 and made more than 200 appearances for the club, scoring 92 goals. He was top scorer in his first season at Elm Park and again in the 1993-94 season - scoring 40 goals as Reading won the Division 2 title. Quinn took over as joint player-manager with Mick Gooding midway through the 1994-95 season following the departure of Mark McGhee, and scored in the play-off final at Wembley as Reading lost 4-3 after extra-time against Bolton and missed out on promotion to the Premiership.

arts.ttl: Ex-Reading chairman Smee has takeover bid rejected
arts.sum: Former Reading chairman Roger Smee says that his bid to purchase the club has been rejected.

arts.ttl: Hull City 'look at' popular Reading boss as replacement for sacked Tim Walter
arts.sum: Hull City have 'looked at' Reading boss Ruben Selles as a possible replacement for the sacked Tim Walter, according to reports. The Tigers sit in the bottom three of the Championship and sacked former Hamburg chief Walter despite his arrival over the summer. Walter's Tigers lost in pre-season to Selles' Reading, bemoaning the Royals' strong tackling for a warm-up fixture. Winning three times in 18 matches to date, Hull are looking to make an appointment as soon as possible.

arts.ttl: Former Reading owner sees bid to take club from Dai Yongge 'rejected'
arts.sum: Reading owner Dai Yongge has rejected a bid from former player and chairman Roger Smee, according to reports. News broke in November that Mr Smee, who played for the club in the 1960s and saved the club from merging with Oxford United, the infamous Thames Valley Royals idea, in 1983. READ MORE: Former Reading FC owner interested in re-acquiring the club Owning the club until being bought out by Sir John Madejski in 1990, Mr Smee was interested in returning to the club to save it again, this time from Dai Yongge.

arts.ttl: Ex-Reading chairman Smee has takeover bid rejected
arts.sum: Former Reading chairman Roger Smee says that his bid to purchase the club has been rejected.
